scenes.text: You dream of a tree older than worlds. Its roots coil through endless dark, drinking from seas of forgotten stars. Its branches pierce nine skies, dripping with light and ash. This is Yggdrasil, the World Tree. Tonight, it is dying. One root is burning, licked by the fires of Muspelheim. Another is splintered and frozen in Jotunheim. In Midgard, the trunk groans like an old god trying not to scream. Cracks spider along the bark, and through them you glimpse realms bleeding into each other, mountains floating where there should be sea, snow falling through a summer sky. You have never seen this tree before. And yet, somehow, it feels like it is seeing you.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text:
A whisper crawls along the bark, a voice woven from wind and memory. "When branches bleed and roots run dry," it murmurs, "the Nine Realms will tilt toward ruin. Gods will grasp. Giants will rise. Fire and frost will flood the middle world." Images flicker in the tree's leaves:
- A serpent choking an ocean.
- A wolf swallowing the sun.
- A bridge of rainbow light shattering like glass. Then you see something stranger: A single figure, small as a splinter against the vastness of Yggdrasil, standing where no mortal should stand. A mortal with no crown, no legend, no songs, just stubbornness and a shadow that leans toward all nine realms at once. The voice curls closer, wrapping around you like cold breath. "A mortal of no renown will tip the scales," it says. The figure in the leaves turns. For a heartbeat, you realize: It is looking back at you.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: The world tree fades into darkness, but the voice remains. "Listen carefully, mortal. The realms slip. Ragnarok stirs before its time. Something, someone, is pushing the story forward." You float weightless, surrounded by overlapping echoes: steel on steel, gods arguing, giants laughing, villagers praying. They swirl around you like storm clouds looking for somewhere to strike.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: "The gods forged a prophecy," the voice continues. "They think it belongs to them. But prophecies wriggle. They find their own paths. And now it has found you." A faint circle of light appears at your feet, like the suggestion of a doorway. Below it, you see blurred shapes: rooftops, forests, a flicker of fire. "Step forward," the voice says. "Take your place in the story. There will be pain. There will be terror. There may be glory. Or..." The light at your feet dims slightly, as if offering you one last out. "You can turn away. Pretend you never heard me."
scenes.speaker: Narrator

choices.text: Step into the light. If the realms are dying, someone has to do something.
Stay where you are. This sounds like a terrible idea and definitely above your pay grade.

scenes.text: You step into the waiting light. For a moment you feel weightless, like your body is an afterthought. The voice chuckles, distant and amused. "Brave," it says. "Or reckless. The difference is usually written afterward." The circle beneath you cracks like thin ice, and the void rushes up in streaks of red, blue, and green as you fall.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: You cross your arms and refuse. "No," you say. "I didn't sign any prophecy. Find another mortal." Silence stretches. Then the voice sighs. "Interesting," it says. "A mortal who rejects destiny before seeing it. You will be... difficult." A circle of light still forms beneath you, bright and insistent.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: "Unfortunately," the voice adds, "choosing not to choose is still a choice. And the realms are fresh out of time." The floor you never agreed to stand on explodes into light, and gravity remembers you exist. You tumble through the dark, dragged toward whatever waits below.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: Falling turns to impact. Your back slams into solid ground and sound hits you all at once. Smoke claws at your throat. Cold wind bites your face. Your fingers dig into rough, damp grass as you push yourself upright and gasp for air. You feel ok, just a little bruised.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: Below you lies a village in Midgard, clustered around a crooked well and a small wooden hall. Overhead, the night sky is torn open by a jagged wound of red light, spilling flame like molten rain. A bull-shaped beast of living lava charges through the streets, tossing carts aside as villagers scream and roofs catch fire. You stand on the hill, watching a creature from Muspelheim rampage through the village below. The voice from the void is gone. This part is up to you.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

choices.text: Charge down the hill and try to help the villagers.
Quietly back away from the chaos. Someone braver, or dumber, can deal with this.
Walk down calmly and try to reason with the flaming bull.
If everything's already on fire… help the bull finish the job.

scenes.text: You sprint down the hillside, grass slapping your boots, smoke stinging your eyes. "Get away from the square!" you shout. A child trips; you grab their arm and shove them toward the trees. The Muspel-bull lowers its head toward villagers struggling with a water cart. You grab a fallen spear and plant your feet between them and the charging beast.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: You walk down the hill with your hands raised, coughing through the smoke. "Easy," you call. "Mighty... bull... thing. Maybe you're lost? Maybe we can talk about this?" Villagers stare at you like you've lost your mind as the Muspel-bull turns its furnace eyes fully on you and snorts, lava cracking along its shoulders.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: There is a long, awful pause. Then the bull says, with all the eloquence of a landslide: "Hmph." It paws the ground and charges straight at you.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: You glance at the burning rooftops, the screaming villagers, the rampaging fire-bull. "Sure," you mutter. "Why not make this worse." You grab a dropped torch and jam it into a dry thatched roof. Flames leap up, eager to join the chaos.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: The Muspel-bull wheels around, molten nostrils flaring. Maybe it smells the smoke on your clothes. Maybe it just doesn't like competition. Either way, it paws the ground, cracks forming in the dirt, and charges straight at you.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: You step backward, away from the ridge, the screams, and the giant lava bull that can turn people into smears. "That's..." you mutter as it gores a wagon in half, "...for someone braver." You slip into the trees, branches whipping your face, the village sounds fading behind you.
scenes.speaker: Narrator

scenes.text: The Muspel-bull thunders toward you, each step shaking the ground and spraying sparks. You tighten your grip on your makeshift weapon. Villagers scatter to doorways, watching with wide, terrified eyes. The bull lowers its head, lava dripping from its horns. The world narrows to its blazing eyes and your refusal to be trampled in your first ten minutes here.
scenes.speaker: Narrator
